intro: Oxyanthus swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
